RT @LeanInOrg Thank you @AOC for highlighting the #genderbias that women face *every day.* And for the record, not hiring or firing a woman because she’s pregnant is AGAINST THE LAW. https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1181695574803931136 QT @AOC I was in a conversation*this year* w/ many people in the room &one guy asked if he could rescind a job offer if he found out a candidate was pregnant.

In my early 20s I was told that if I got engaged, don’t wear the ring to interviews to better my odds.

This is *present day.*
If you don't think our tax system is rigged in favor of the wealthy, remember that the Waltons (worth over $200 billion) pay a lower tax rate than entry-level workers at Walmart.

RT @SergioGor It’s expected that some in the GOP who took us into these endless quagmires in the Middle East are unhappy about ending wars, but where is the left? The silence is resounding. Silence is not always golden. @realDonaldTrump is doing the right thing & should have bipartisan support

Congratulations to @UTAustin's John B. Goodenough, who has been awarded the 2019 #NobelPrize in chemistry for his collaboration on developing lithium-ion batteries. Still innovating at 97 years-old, he continues to improve our society & way of life. https://news.utexas.edu/2019/10/09/nobel-prize-in-chemistry-goes-to-john-goodenough-of-the-university-of-texas-at-austin/

Trump decision isn’t about drawing down US military involvement at all. 

Remember that earlier this year, Trump VETOED Congress’ attempt to end US involvement in the Yemen War.

He has significant personal financial conflicts of interest in this situation, among other concerns. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1181922793451065345 QT @washingtonpost Turkey's Erdogan announces start of military offensive in northern Syria after Trump's decision to withdraw U.S. troops https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/with-turkish-offensive-looming-syrian-kurds-mobilize-civilian-defense/2019/10/09/4efca794-ea02-11e9-a329-7378fbfa1b63_story.html

Autocrats: “Jump!”
Trump: “How high?”

- Trump admin foreign policy, 2019
Congress must assert its important responsibility over foreign policy and serve as a check on this unstable president.

Americans pay up to 10 times as much as consumers in other countries for the same medications. By passing H.R. 3, we can #LowerDrugCosts for seniors & families nationwide. https://www.vox.com/2019/9/19/20856948/house-democrats-prescription-drug-prices

The hundreds of thousands of people currently living on the streets face serious risk of violence. That's why I’m introducing a bill to invest $13 billion to eradicate chronic homelessness in America. We cannot afford to wait.  https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/06/nyregion/chinatown-bowery-homeless-murders-nyc.html

@alistairws @TeamWarren Thank you for fighting for LGBTQ+ rights at the Supreme Court yesterday, Alistair—I’m in this fight alongside you all the way.

Our health care system today exists to make as much profit as possible for a handful of rich executives.

Maybe I'm "radical," but I believe our health care system should exist to keep people healthy. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1181928618160775168/img/NHF_xiuITnWTnxQk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1181928618160775168/vid/320x320/FjTCO19cHa8jYJst.mp4?tag=13

Then cut deal with Erdogan allowing him to wipe them out. 

Damage to our reputation & national interest will be extraordinary & long lasting.

The insurance and pharmaceutical companies are going to spend millions and millions of dollars attempting to defeat us and stop Medicare for All. Trump may say he’s not cooperating with the impeachment trial before him, but he’s not dictator-in-chief. As members of Congress, we all swore an oath to uphold and defend the Constitution and that includes oversight of the executive. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1181736019093327872/img/X15qNWDps6vCsxB8.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1181736019093327872/vid/480x270/xV0up-FtUEf1wPye.mp4?tag=13
The NBA should be better than this. We should not be willing instruments of Chinese censorship. #StandForFreedom

Facebook already helped elect Donald Trump once. Now, they're deliberately allowing a candidate to intentionally lie to the American people. 

This is a serious threat to our democracy. We need transparency and accountability from Facebook. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1181811559598825472 QT @nytimes Facebook refused to take down an ad from the Trump campaign that promoted unsubstantiated accusations about Joe Biden. Facebook said the ad, which has been viewed 5 million times on the site, did not violate its policies.
https://trib.al/znbX6dL

We can fight back against pregnancy discrimination by sharing similar stories—and by fighting for the big, structural change we need to protect pregnant people and their families. Together, we'll win. https://twitter.com/SenGillibrand/status/1182025280493428738 QT @SenGillibrand Pregnancy discrimination was a serious problem in 1971 and it continues to be a widespread issue today. The attacks on @ewarren for sharing her experiences are absurd, and I’m glad to see women sharing their real, powerful stories. We must do more to fight for workplace equality.

RT @SenatorRomney Reports indicate Turkey is predictably attacking the Kurdish allies we abandoned. It’s a tragic loss of life among friends shamefully betrayed. We can only hope the President’s decision does not lead to even greater loss of life and a resurgence of ISIS.

This was only a matter of "when" after Trump's reckless decision to abruptly withdraw troops from Syria. We've completely abandoned our Kurdish allies—one of our most effective partners in fighting ISIS. Difficult to see how any of our allies can trust us after this betrayal. https://twitter.com/cnnbrk/status/1181926689124864005 QT @cnnbrk Turkey launches its military offensive into northeast Syria, Turkish President Erdogan says. The operation starts days after the Trump administration said it was pulling US troops back from the area. 
https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/09/politics/syria-turkey-invasion-intl-hnk/index.html http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGcL9BUW4AAHpEw.jpg
RT @CNBCPolitics NBA should not be an 'arm of Chinese censorship' by bowing to pressure, says GOP Texas Sen. Ted Cruz https://trib.al/kL8Y3Zg

I stand in solidarity with @seiu521 and Santa Clara County public workers who work hard for our most vulnerable and deserve to be treated fairly. Children, seniors, and families rely on the critical services these workers provide. It's time we had #UnionsForAll.

Internationally recognized poet and novelist Sandra Cisneros has enriched the hearts and minds of many, exploring the intersection of race, gender, and culture in her works. #HispanicHeritageMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGdpFP6W4AEudai.jpg

RT @chrishughes I have a feeling that many people in tech will see Warren's thread implying FB empowers Trump over Warren as unfair. But Mark, by deciding to allow outright lies in political ads to travel on Facebook, is embracing the philosophy behind Trumpism and thereby tipping the scales. https://twitter.com/ewarren/status/1181348882900496384 QT @ewarren They’re allowing Trump to spend over $1 million a week right now for ads on their platform—including ones that air the same lies that TV stations won’t. Here’s an example of an ad that Facebook let Trump run despite being obviously untrue: https://popular.info/p/facebook-allows-the-trump-campaign http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGT-inBXUAE2PWT.jpg

The communities on the front lines of the climate crisis must lead the way toward a clean energy economy, and I promise to elevate their voices in this fight. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGeOXL6WwAAvLRc.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGeOXL1XoAAOdja.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGeOXL1XkAIL33o.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGeOXL0WsAEKP9Y.jpg

As I’ve traveled this country, I’ve heard the human stories from frontline communities. Families where many people have cancer. Coastal communities facing the threat of rising sea levels. Ruined land and poisoned water. These communities need justice—and I will stand with them.

Finally, we will hold corporate polluters accountable for the damage they've done in frontline communities and for their role in the climate crisis. My administration will impose steep fines on violators, which we'll reinvest in impacted communities.

RT @MinnesotaDFL THREAD: Trump is coming to Minnesota this week to break our blue wall and flip our state red in 2020. That can’t happen. We’re launching a #MoneyBlizzard to make sure we have the resources to fight back against his hateful campaign. RT & Donate: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/moneyblizzard?refcode=TIL1

And when I’m the Democratic nominee for president, I’m not going to change a thing in how I run my campaign: No PAC money. No federal lobbyist money. No special access or call time with wealthy donors or high-dollar fundraisers to underwrite my campaign.
Congratulations to @StevenLouisReed on his historic election as Montgomery, Alabama's first African American mayor! I can't wait to see the big, structural change you make.

Will it be out NATO allies the Turks? Will it be Assad? Will it be Islamic rebels? Which ones? They want to keep starting  endless wars in conflicts that go back hundreds of years, but what they want makes no sense.

Yesterday I continued my tour through the Indo-Pacific with a visit in Tokyo, Japan. There, I met with PM Shinzō Abe & DM Taro Kono and expressed to them my gratitude for Japan's contributions to the United States and Texas' economies. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGctkiBXkAAZHvP.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGctkiAXoAEQbej.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGctkh_W4AE3PUr.jpg

RT @KevinMKruse This is the same man who’s now defending the White House’s claim that it can withhold information and documents from Congress. https://twitter.com/lotsofuss/status/1181721416728625153 QT @lotsofuss 2012

"The notion that you can withhold information and documents from Congress no matter whether you are the party in power or not in power is wrong. Respect for the rule of law must mean something, irrespective of the vicissitudes of political cycles."

This is why it’s so important to listen to & follow the leadership of communities on the frontlines of pollution & climate change.

My number one concern is that everyone affected by PG&E's power shutoff is safe, so I encourage residents to heed all warnings and exercise caution.

But let's be clear: PG&E need to be held responsible for the maintenance of their power lines. This is simply unacceptable. https://twitter.com/pge4me/status/1182015309852676096 QT @PGE4Me #PSPS: Additional proactive shutoffs for safety will begin later this afternoon and into early evening in portions of these counties (see table). This phase of the safety shutoff also includes some parts of Mendocino and Calaveras not turned off this morning. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGdcqJzXoAADhjJ.png

I’m going to continue helping the Democratic Party and Democratic candidates everywhere so we have the resources not just to beat Donald Trump but also to win back Congress and state legislatures all across the country. That’s how we’re going to make big, structural change.

As we fight the climate crisis, we have an opportunity to create millions of good-paying American jobs and rebuild our unions. We cannot fight climate change with a low-wage economy. Workers and unions must be our partners in this fight.
The Cheney/Graham neocon War Caucus wants to come back to DC and declare a war. My question for them is - who will you declare it on?

Industrial pollution has been concentrated in communities of color due to decades of discrimination and racism—and a system that puts corporate profits before people. We need big, structural change, focused on and led by members of those communities.

Federal govs are failing to act on the climate crisis.

We can’t wait for others to lead.

That’s why I’m in Copenhagen w/ C40 mayors, trade unions, youth climate strikers, business & citizen reps from around the world to rally for a Global #GreenNewDeal. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3A__bit.ly_global-2DGND&d=DwIFaQ&c=L93KkjKsAC98uTvC4KvQDdTDRzAeWDDRmG6S3YXllH0&r=YZVdOIwIiGuKBkwt6Rj2-cDYGmkj8O172CVw0v1I4fM&m=t_sMm7MulD9Zf2Iq6Ush6iX9KszpYoy6lcySUyFptEc&s=POGZHBMe_b40VpCKQhZVvIyG_8PM1Z1008Gimb9SR5U&e=

Whatever issue got you into politics, progress is hard because of one thing: Money. Our government works great for the wealthy and well-connected but not for anyone else.

This is not a case of sending American troops there. They are already there and Trump is withdrawing them, giving the Turkish Army permission to invade.

Kurdish fighters have fought and died in our joint effort to eliminate ISIS. They should not be abandoned in this way.

Thank you @GovMurphy & the NJ legislature for continuing to lead on paid family leave.

The federal gov’t—the nation's largest employer—must follow. We’re the only industrialized nation without guaranteed paid family leave, but w/ #FLMA we can provide it to 2m federal employees. https://twitter.com/njdotcom/status/1181535680066936833 QT @njdotcom Baby on the way? N.J. just made it easier to get family leave, temporary disability. https://www.nj.com/politics/2019/10/baby-on-the-way-nj-just-made-it-easier-to-get-family-leave-temporary-disability.html?utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=njdotcom_sf&utm_source=twitter&utm_content=nj_twitter_njdotcom http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EGWocIfXoAAMXA8.jpg

But we must ensure that we honor our commitments to fossil fuel workers as we transition to the new green economy. We'll ensure that new jobs have similar wages and benefits. And I'll fight to protect the pensions and benefits that they've earned.

From F-35 fighter jets to @Toyota’s trucks, both made in TX, Japan’s investments are creating jobs for Texans & growing our economy. That’s a clear illustration of the synergies between the US & Japan. Both of our countries are benefiting from trade & from our strong friendship.

My Children’s Agenda will:

✅Ensure they have access to health care and high-quality education
✅Stop the treatment of children as adults in the criminal justice system
✅Dramatically reduce child poverty

Where politicians hold corporations to account, not give them billions in corporate handouts.

It won’t be easy, but it can be done.

Shutting off power will be enormously costly to local economies and dangerous for vulnerable populations. This is not a solution to the climate crisis.
